title: Spread the Legend
description: You work to spread the word of the party’s heroics and achievements, both through word of mouth and by distributing chapbooks or one-sheets detailing their exploits. Attempt a basic Arts check to determine the success of your efforts. If you have secured a printing press for the kingdom, the Arts check gains a +2 item bonus.

criticalSuccess.msg: Not only do your stories bring pride and patriotism to the nation, but they also help increase its glory. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d6">Lose 1d6 Unrest</button>, and <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="fame" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Fame Next Turn</button>. In addition, if the kingdom experiences a dangerous random event during this turn’s Event Phase, reduce that event’s level modifier by 1.

success.msg: The rousing and inspiring stories you spread about the PCs helps to bring the nation together. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d6">Lose 1d6 Unrest</button>

failure.msg: You avoid spreading unfortunate news, but only just barely. The citizens are only slightly entertained by their leaders’ exploits. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="lose" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Lose 1 Unrest</button>.

criticalFailure.msg: You accidentally spreads news of a humiliating or embarrassing nature, causing the people of the kingdom to lose respect for their leaders. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="unrest" data-mode="gain" data-turn="now" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Gain 1d4 Unrest</button>.
